citation.article-title: Georgenia soli sp. nov., isolated from iron-ore-contaminated soil in India
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Georgenia soli sp. nov.
Georgenia soli (so′li. L. gen. n. soli of soil, the source of the type strain).
Coccoid cells, about 1–1.5 μm in diameter.
Gram-positive, oxidase-positive, catalase-positive, showing an aerobic respiratory metabolism.
Good growth occurs after 3 days of incubation on nutrient agar at 25–30 °C.
The peptidoglycan type is A4α l-Lys←l-Glu.
The major quinone is menaquinone MK-8(H4).

The polar lipid profile is composed of the major compound diphosphatidylglycerol, moderate amounts of a phosphatidylinositol-mannoside, phosphatidylinositol and minor amounts of another phosphatidylmannoside and phosphatidylglycerol.
Major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 1 A (Table 1).
Carbon source utilization (including differentiating characters using identical conditions) are indicated in Table 2.
Isolated from iron-ore-contaminated soil near New Mangalore Port, Karnataka, India.
